definition: Dimensional analysis of Earth - 3D layered system evolving through 4D geological time, tectonic plates as 2D surfaces interacting in 3D, deep time written in rock layers
geometric_view: Earth as 3D layered system evolving through 4D geological time; tectonic plates as 2D surfaces interacting in 3D

plate_tectonics.principle: 2D surfaces (plates) moving on 3D sphere creating mountains, earthquakes
plate_tectonics.mechanism: Convection in mantle drives surface plate motion

boundaries.divergent: Plates moving apart (mid-ocean ridges, rift valleys)

plate_tectonics.geometric_essence: 2D surfaces interacting on 3D sphere over 4D deep time

geological_time.principle: 4D history written in rock layers - stratigraphic sequences
geological_time.law_of_superposition: Older layers on bottom, younger on top (unless deformed)
geological_time.unconformities: Gaps in rock record - erosion or non-deposition
geological_time.geometric_essence: Rock layers as 4D memory storage - Earth's autobiography

rock_cycle.principle: Transformation between igneous, sedimentary, metamorphic through 4D process
rock_cycle.sedimentary: Formed from deposited sediments (sandstone, limestone, shale)
rock_cycle.metamorphic: Formed from heat/pressure transformation (marble, schist, gneiss)
rock_cycle.cycle: Any rock type can transform into any other given time and conditions

crystal_geometry.principle: Minerals as 3D geometric lattices with symmetry groups
crystal_geometry.symmetry: Point groups and space groups classify crystal structures
crystal_geometry.properties: Crystal geometry determines physical properties (cleavage, hardness)

earth_structure.crust: Thin outer shell (5-70 km), brittle, cool
earth_structure.mantle: Thick middle layer (2900 km), ductile, convecting
earth_structure.outer_core: Liquid iron-nickel (2200 km), generates magnetic field
earth_structure.inner_core: Solid iron-nickel (1200 km radius), extreme pressure
earth_structure.discontinuities: Seismic boundaries between layers (Moho, D'', Gutenberg)

erosion_deposition.principle: Surface transformation through time - landscape evolution
erosion_deposition.landscapes: Mountains erode → sediment transported → deposited in basins
erosion_deposition.timescale: Mountains take millions of years to erode

earthquakes.geometry: Fault = 2D plane of rupture in 3D crust

mountain_building.timescale: Millions of years to build, millions to erode

observables: Tectonic plate boundaries and motion (GPS, seismology)
controls: Human activity (mining, dam building, climate change)

geologic_timescale.paleozoic: 541-252 Ma - Cambrian explosion, land plants, reptiles
geologic_timescale.mesozoic: 252-66 Ma - Age of dinosaurs, flowering plants
geologic_timescale.deep_time_concept: Millions and billions of years - incomprehensible scale

2D_surfaces.description: Tectonic plates, fault planes, stratigraphic surfaces
2D_surfaces.evidence: Key geological structures are 2D surfaces moving/deforming in 3D

3D_volumes.description: Rock bodies, Earth layers, geological structures
3D_volumes.evidence: Earth is 3D layered sphere with 3D rock volumes

4D_history.evidence: All geology is 4D - present is key to past, past written in rock

reduction_examples.raw: India colliding with Asia over 50 million years creating Himalayas

reduction.evidence: Plate convergence as 4D process building mountains through deep time

reduction_examples.raw: Sedimentary rock layers recording 100 million years of deposition

reduction.evidence: Strata as 4D memory - each layer records moment in deep time
Crystal as 3D geometric lattice with perfect symmetry

integration_with_cfo.principle: Earth = 3D layered system + 2D plate surfaces + 4D deep time history
integration_with_cfo.mechanism: Internal heat drives plate motion → surface change over geological time
integration_with_cfo.coherence: Rock cycle and plate tectonics maintain Earth's dynamic equilibrium
integration_with_cfo.sacred: Rocks record sacred 4D history - Earth's memory written in stone
